segment.documentation: BGM, A segment for unique identification of the Inventory Report document, name and its number.

FTX, A segment enabling the specification of coded information or free text information relevant to the whole message. In computer to computer exchange such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
DTM, Date/time/period related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to identify the date at which the inventory report was issued.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments giving references and where necessary, their dates relating to the whole message, e.g., a contract, dispatch advice number, etc.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents relating to the whole inventory report message, e.g., a contract, dispatch advice number, etc.
DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying names, addresses and locations relevant to the whole message.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment for identifying names and addresses and their functions relevant for the whole Inventory Report. Indications of the parties involved is recommended for the Inventory Report message. They are to be given in the NAD segment. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified.
LOC, A segment giving more specific location information in addition to the address specified in the NAD segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments giving references only relating to the specified party, rather than the whole message.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents and other numbers pertinent to the party identified in the NAD segment.
DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to identify person, function, department, and where appropriate numbers to which the communications should be directed.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify person, function, department, to whom communications should be directed.
COM, Identifying communication types and numbers for the entities specified in CTA, e.g., FAX, TELEX, telephone, etc.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to indicate currencies used for financial evaluation.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment specifying currencies, and, if required, rates of exchange for the whole message, e.g., evaluation currency.
DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the currencies. 4.1.2 Detail section Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments providing details of all package levels of the inventory report. This segment group provides the capability to give the hierarchical relationship. The group defines a local top-down packaging structure.

segment.documentation: CPS, A segment identifying the sequence in which packing has been done, e.g. handling unit (pallet), package (box).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments identifying packaging, marks and numbers, date and time information.

segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number and type of packages. DE7224, number of packages must not be used.
PCI, A segment specifying markings and labels used on individual physical units (packages) described in the PAC Segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments providing package quantities with package identification and relevant date/time information.

segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to provide quantity information suitably qualified for the packages referred to in the PAC Segment, e.g., opening quantity, closing quantity, adjustment quantity. This quantity segment may contain any number of packages.
GIN, A segment to provide serial-, batch-, label- or packaging number. These may be simple numbers or ranges of numbers.
DTM, Date/time period relevant to the package, e.g. production date, expiration date, etc.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: SG11-SG12 A group of segments providing detailed information on each line of the inventory report.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying a specific line item in the inventory report. All other segments in the detail section refer to the line item.
PIA, A segment to allow the transmission of additional product identification.
IMD, A segment for describing the item.
NAD, A segment enabling the specification of the manufacturer of a line item.
MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of the inventory item, either in original or packaged form.
ALI, A segment indicating that the line item is subject to special conditions due to origin custom preference or commercial factors.
LOC, A segment indicating details regarding specific place or location of the specified line item.
DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the line item.

FTX, A segment enabling the specification coded or free text information relevant to a line item. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments giving references only relating to the specified line item.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents and other numbers pertinent to the line item.
DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments to identify person, function, department, and where appropriate numbers to which the communications should be directed. It may be used to denominate specific contact information related to an individual product item referred to by the LIN segment and subject to an inventory report.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify person, function, department, to whom communications should be directed.
COM, Identifying communication types and numbers for the entities specified in CTA, e.g., FAX, TELEX, telephone, etc.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: SG15-SG16 A group of segments providing a quantity with all inventory management related information and optionally package details, line item currencies and references.

segment.documentation: INV, A segment to provide all the parameters required for an inventory activity report, e.g. the reason for an inventory movement, the direction of an inventory movement, etc.

QTY, A segment to provide a quantity information suitably qualified, for the product referred to by the LIN segment, e.g. opening balance quantity, closing balance quantity, inventory movement quantity, etc.
GIN, A segment to provide specific serial, batch or packaging numbers to which the specific quantity relates. These may be single numbers or ranges of numbers.
LOC, A segment indicating details regarding specific place or location of the quantity referred to in QTY.
DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the quantity.
STS, A segment giving transport status report, e.g., damaged, customs refusal and totally missing.

FTX, A segment enabling the specification of coded or free text information relevant to a specific inventory movement. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A segment group to identify the owner of the inventory.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the owner of the stock.
LOC, To identify a country/place/location/related location one/related location two.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments to provide price/cost/value information.

segment.documentation: PRI, A segment to provide the price/cost/value, suitable qualified.
CUX, A segment specifying currencies, and if required, rates of exchange, e.g., evaluation currency.
DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the currencies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments giving references only relating to the specified quantity.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents and other numbers pertinent to the quantity.
DTM, Date/time/period as applied to the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments providing details of all package levels item or quantity. This segment group provides the capability to give the hierarchical relationship. The group defines a logical top-down packaging structure.

segment.documentation: CPS, A segment identifying the sequence in which packing has been done, e.g., handling unit (pallet), package (box).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments specifying the number and type of packages, identification of the packages and date/time information.

segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number and type of packages (physical units and the physical type of packaging).
MEA, A segment specifying physical measurement of packages / physical units described in the PAC segment.
QTY, A segment to specify the quantity per package described in the PAC segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A segment group specifying markings, labels and packing.

segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and / or labels used on individual physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment.
RFF, A segment for referencing the package identification e.g. master label number.
DTM, Date/time/period relevant to the package, e.g., production date, expiration date, etc.
GIN, A segment to provide serial, batch, label or packaging number. These may be simple numbers or ranges of numbers.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments to give specific package related identification numbers and dates.

segment.documentation: GIR, A segment to specify a set of related identifications specific to a package.
DTM, A segment to give specific dates for the package, e.g. production date, etc.
